events.message: The candidate submitted their application for the software engineer role, showcasing experience in full-stack development and various programming languages.
The application was reviewed and categorised under the Engineering department, specifically for the backend developer position within the software team.
A recruiter specializing in engineering hires has been assigned to handle this candidate's process and to coordinate all upcoming interviews.
The recruiter conducted an initial screening call to discuss the candidate’s background, technical skills, and motivations for applying to the engineering position.
The candidate replied promptly, expressing enthusiasm for the role and willingness to participate in the technical interview stage.
A technical interview was scheduled for the candidate next week, focusing on backend systems, algorithms, and problem-solving skills.
The candidate successfully completed the technical interview, demonstrating strong coding abilities and sound knowledge of system architecture.
An HR interview was arranged to further discuss the candidate’s cultural fit, compensation expectations, and career goals.
The candidate completed the HR interview with positive feedback regarding their attitude, aspirations, and alignment with company values.
A formal job offer was proposed to the candidate including salary details, benefits, and other employment terms.
The candidate provided feedback on the offer, expressing satisfaction with the terms and excitement to join the engineering team.
The candidate officially accepted the job offer, confirming their commitment to start the role on the agreed upon date.
The onboarding process began with the candidate being introduced to the team, setting up necessary accounts, and completing required documentation.
The hiring process was formally closed after successful onboarding and confirmation of the new engineer joining the company full-time.
